blocks.name: csup
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include supremum of class ` A ` . Here ` R ` is ordinarily a relation that strictly orders class ` B ` . For example, ` R ` could be 'less than' and ` B ` could be the set of real numbers.
blocks.origin: prop class csup(class c0, class c1, class c2) { sup(c0, c1, c2) }

blocks.content: Extend class notation to include infimum of class ` A ` . Here ` R ` is ordinarily a relation that strictly orders class ` B ` . For example, ` R ` could be 'less than' and ` B ` could be the set of real numbers.

df-sup
blocks.content: Define the supremum of class ` A ` . It is meaningful when ` R ` is a relation that strictly orders ` B ` and when the supremum exists. For example, ` R ` could be 'less than', ` B ` could be the set of real numbers, and ` A ` could be the set of all positive reals whose square is less than 2; in this case the supremum is defined as the square root of 2 per ~ sqrtval . See ~ dfsup2 for alternate definition not requiring dummy variables. (Contributed by NM, 22-May-1999.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-sup(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(csup(c0, c1, c2), cuni(crab(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-sup(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  âŠ¢ sup(c0, c1, c2)= â‹ƒ { s0 âˆˆ c1 |(âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ c0, Â¬ s0[c2]s1)âˆ§ âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ c1,(s1[c2]s0 â†’ âˆƒ(s2 âˆˆ c0, s1[c2]s2))))}
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s2, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s2, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s2, c1)
}

blocks.name: df-inf
blocks.content: Define the infimum of class ` A ` . It is meaningful when ` R ` is a relation that strictly orders ` B ` and when the infimum exists. For example, ` R ` could be 'less than', ` B ` could be the set of real numbers, and ` A ` could be the set of all positive reals; in this case the infimum is 0. The infimum is defined as the supremum using the converse ordering relation. In the given example, 0 is the supremum of all reals (greatest real number) for which all positive reals are greater. (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: dfsup2
blocks.content: Quantifier free definition of supremum. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 19-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: nfsup
blocks.content: Hypothesis builder for supremum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm nfsup(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wnfc(s0, csup(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c1)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
} = {
  nfcxfr(s0, csup(c0, c1, c2), cuni(cdif(c1, cun(cima(ccnv(c2), c0), cima(c2, cdif(c1, cima(ccnv(c2), c0)))))))
  dfsup2(c0, c1, c2)
  nfuni(s0, cdif(c1, cun(cima(ccnv(c2), c0), cima(c2, cdif(c1, cima(ccnv(c2), c0))))))
  nfdif(s0, c1, cun(cima(ccnv(c2), c0), cima(c2, cdif(c1, cima(ccnv(c2), c0)))))
  nfun(s0, cima(ccnv(c2), c0), cima(c2, cdif(c1, cima(ccnv(c2), c0))))
  nfima(s0, c2, cdif(c1, cima(ccnv(c2), c0)))
  nfdif(s0, c1, cima(ccnv(c2), c0))
  nfima(s0, ccnv(c2), c0)
  nfcnv(s0, c2)
}

  dfsup2(c0, c1, c2)
  nfuni(s0, (c1 \((`' c2 " c0)â‹ƒ(c2 "(c1 \(`' c2 " c0))))))
  nfdif(s0, c1, ((`' c2 " c0)â‹ƒ(c2 "(c1 \(`' c2 " c0)))))

thm supmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrmo(s0, c0, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)

blocks.name: supeu
blocks.content: A supremum is unique. Similar to Theorem I.26 of [Apostol] p. 24 (but for suprema in general). (Contributed by NM, 12-Oct-2004.)

blocks.name: eqsup
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for an element to be equal to the supremum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: eqsupd
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for an element to be equal to the supremum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm eqsupd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csup(c0, c1, c2), c3))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wn(wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3))), wrex(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mp3and(w0, wceq(csup(c0, c1, c2), c3), wcel(c3, c1), wral(s0, c0, wn(wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0)))), wral(s0, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3), wrex(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))))))
  ralrimiva(s0, c0, w0, wn(wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0))))
  ralrimiva(s0, c1, w0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3), wrex(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))))
  expr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3), wrex(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))))
  eqsup(s0, s1, c3, c1, c0, c2, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eqsupd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’ sup(c0, c1, c2)= c3)
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c2 â‰º c1)
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c3 âˆˆ c1)
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c0)â†’ Â¬ c3[c2]s0)
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§(s0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ s0[c2]c3))â†’ âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, s0[c2]s1))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c3)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  mp3and(w0, sup(c0, c1, c2)= c3, c3 âˆˆ c1, âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ c0, Â¬ c3[c2]s0), âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ c1,(s0[c2]c3 â†’ âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, s0[c2]s1))))
  ralrimiva(s0, c0, w0, Â¬ c3[c2]s0)
  ralrimiva(s0, c1, w0, (s0[c2]c3 â†’ âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, s0[c2]s1)))
  expr(w0, s0 âˆˆ c1, s0[c2]c3, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, s0[c2]s1))
  eqsup(s0, s1, c3, c1, c0, c2, w0)
}

blocks.name: supcl
blocks.content: A supremum belongs to its base class (closure law). See also ~ supub and ~ suplub . (Contributed by NM, 12-Oct-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm supcl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(csup(c0, c1, c2), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
} = {
  eqeltrd(csup(c0, c1, c2), c1, crio(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2))))))), w0)
  supval2(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(crio(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2))))))), c1), wreu(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2))))))))
  supeu(s0, s1, s2, c1, c0, c2, w0)
  riotacl(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2)))))))
}

  supval2(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  syl(w0, iota(s0 âˆˆ c1,(âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ c0, Â¬ s0[c2]s1)âˆ§ âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ c1,(s1[c2]s0 â†’ âˆƒ(s2 âˆˆ c0, s1[c2]s2)))))âˆˆ c1, âˆƒ!(s0 âˆˆ c1,(âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ c0, Â¬ s0[c2]s1)âˆ§ âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ c1,(s1[c2]s0 â†’ âˆƒ(s2 âˆˆ c0, s1[c2]s2))))))

blocks.name: supub
blocks.content: A supremum is an upper bound. See also ~ supcl and ~ suplub . This proof demonstrates how to expand an iota-based definition ( ~ df-iota ) using ~ riotacl2 . (Contributed by NM, 12-Oct-2004.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm supub(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, c0))))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c3, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
} = {
  syl(w0, wi(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, c0))), wral(hs0, c1, wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, cv(hs0)))))
  syl(w0, wral(hs0, c1, wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, cv(hs0)))), wcel(csup(c1, c2, c3), crab(s0, c2, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))))))
  sseldi(csup(c1, c2, c3), crab(s0, c2, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))), crab(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))), w0)
  ss2rabi(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)))))), wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))))
  a1i(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wi(wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)))))), wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))))
  simpl(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))
  eqeltrd(csup(c1, c2, c3), crab(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))), crio(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))), w0)
  supval2(s0, s1, s2, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(crio(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))), crab(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)))))))), wreu(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2))))))))
  supeu(s0, s1, s2, c2, c1, c3, w0)
  riotacl2(s0, c2, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)))))))
  simprbi(wcel(csup(c1, c2, c3), crab(s0, c2, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))))), wral(hs0, c1, wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, cv(hs0)))), wcel(csup(c1, c2, c3), c2))
  elrab(s0, csup(c1, c2, c3), c2, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(hs0, c1, wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, cv(hs0)))))
  syl5bb(wceq(cv(s0), csup(c1, c2, c3)), wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(hs0, c1, wn(wbr(csup(c1, c2, c3), c3, cv(hs0)))), wral(hs0, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(hs0)))))
  cbvralv(s1, hs0, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(hs0))))
  notbid(wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(hs0)))

blocks.content: A supremum is the least upper bound. See also ~ supcl and ~ supub . (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: supmax
blocks.content: The greatest element of a set is its supremum. Note that the converse is not true; the supremum might not be an element of the set considered. (Contributed by Jeff Hoffman, 17-Jun-2008.) (Proof shortened by OpenAI, 30-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm supmax(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csup(c0, c1, c2), c3))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c0))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wn(wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqsupd(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  syl2an2r(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3)), wrex(hs0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(hs0))), wcel(c3, c0), wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3))
  simprr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3))
  rspcev(hs0, c3, c0, wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3), wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(hs0)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c3, cv(s0), c2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3))
}

  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’ sup(c0, c1, c2)= c3)
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c2 â‰º c1)

  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c3 âˆˆ c0)

  âŠ£ d(s0, c3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, w0)
} = {

  simprr(w0, s0 âˆˆ c1, s0[c2]c3)

  breq2(hs0, c3, s0, c2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)

blocks.name: supgtoreq
blocks.content: The supremum of a finite set is greater than or equal to all the elements of the set. (Contributed by AV, 1-Oct-2019.)

thm supgtoreq(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, csup(c4, c3, c1)))
} = {
  notnotrd(w0, wo(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
  mtbird(w0, wn(wo(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wceq(c0, c2))), wbr(c2, c1, c0))
  eqnbrtrd(c2, c1, c0, csup(c4, c3, c1), w0)

blocks.name: infcl
blocks.content: An infimum belongs to its base class (closure law). See also ~ inflb and ~ infglb . (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm infcl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cinf(c0, c1, c2), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c1, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s2), c2, cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
} = {
  syl5eqel(cinf(c0, c1, c2), c1, csup(c0, c1, ccnv(c2)), w0)
  df-inf(c0, c1, c2)
  supcl(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, ccnv(c2), w0)
  sylib(w0, wor(ccnv(c2), c1), wor(c2, c1))
  cnvso(c2, c1)
  infcllem(s0, s1, s2, c1, c0, c2, w0)
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c2)
  diff.ccnv.s(s1, c2)
  diff.ccnv.s(s2, c2)
}

blocks.name: inflb
blocks.content: An infimum is a lower bound. See also ~ infcl and ~ infglb . (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm inflb(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wbr(c0, c2, cinf(c1, c3, c2)))))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c3, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c3, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s2), c2, cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
} = {
  ex(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wn(wbr(c0, c2, cinf(c1, c3, c2))))
  mtbird(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(c0, c2, cinf(c1, c3, c2)), wbr(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), ccnv(c2), c0))
  imp(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wn(wbr(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), ccnv(c2), c0)))
  supub(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c3, ccnv(c2), w0)
  bitrd(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(c0, c2, cinf(c1, c3, c2)), wbr(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), ccnv(c2), c0), wbr(c0, c2, csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2))))
  breq2d(c0, c2, cinf(c1, c3, c2), csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
  a1i(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cinf(c1, c3, c2), csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2))))
  df-inf(c1, c3, c2)
  sylan(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c0, c2, csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2))), wbr(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), ccnv(c2), c0)), wcel(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), c3))
  supcl(s0, s1, s2, c1, c3, ccnv(c2), w0)
  sylib(w0, wor(ccnv(c2), c3), wor(c2, c3))
  cnvso(c2, c3)
  infcllem(s0, s1, s2, c3, c1, c2, w0)
  bicomd(wa(wcel(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), c3), wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(c0, c2, csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2))), wbr(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), ccnv(c2), c0))
  brcnvg(csup(c1, c3, ccnv(c2)), c3, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c2)
  diff.ccnv.s(s1, c2)
  diff.ccnv.s(s2, c2)
}

blocks.name: infglb
blocks.content: An infimum is the greatest lower bound. See also ~ infcl and ~ inflb . (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2020.)

thm infglb(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0)), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0))))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c3, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s1, c1, wa(wral(s2, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  expimpd(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)))
  sylbid(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3))))
  syl5bb(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3))), wbr(csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c3, c0))
  breq1i(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0, csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)))
  df-inf(c2, c1, c3)
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wb(wbr(csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c3, c0), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)))), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c1))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c1))
  supcl(s1, s2, s0, c2, c1, ccnv(c3), w0)
  bicomd(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c1)), wbr(csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c3, c0), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3))))
  brcnvg(c0, c1, csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3)), c1, c3)
  sylibd(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3))), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), cv(s0))))
  expdimp(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), csup(c2, c1, ccnv(c3))), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), cv(s0))))
  suplub(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, ccnv(c3), c2, w0)
  sylib(w0, wor(ccnv(c3), c1), wor(c3, c1))
  cnvso(c3, c1)
  infcllem(s1, s2, s0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  rexbidv(s0, c2, wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0))
  sylancl(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), universe))
  simpr(w0, wcel(c0, c1))

blocks.name: infnlb
blocks.content: A lower bound is not greater than the infimum. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm infnlb(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)))), wn(wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0))))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c3, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s1, c1, wa(wral(s2, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c3, cv(s1)))), wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  expimpd(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0))), wn(wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0)))
  con2d(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wral(s0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0))), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0))
  syl6ib(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0), wn(wral(s0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)))), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)))
  expdimp(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cinf(c2, c1, c3), c3, c0), wrex(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0)))
  infglb(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  dfrex2(s0, c2, wbr(cv(s0), c3, c0))
}

blocks.name: infex

blocks.name: infmin
blocks.content: The smallest element of a set is its infimum. Note that the converse is not true; the infimum might not be an element of the set considered. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm infmin(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cinf(c0, c1, c2), c3))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c0))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c2, c3)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqinfd(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  syl2an2r(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0))), wrex(hs0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), c2, cv(s0))), wcel(c3, c0), wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0)))
  simprr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0)))

  breq1(cv(hs0), c3, c2, cv(s0))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c3, c2, cv(s0)))
}

blocks.name: infeu
blocks.content: An infimum is unique. (Contributed by AV, 6-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm infeu(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wreu(s0, c0, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s2), c2, cv(s1))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wor(c2, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wa(wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), wrex(s2, c1, wbr(cv(s2), c2, cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)

blocks.name: infsupprpr
blocks.content: The infimum of a proper pair is less than the supremum of this pair. (Contributed by AV, 13-Mar-2023.)

blocks.name: infsn
blocks.content: The infimum of a singleton. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2007.)

blocks.name: inf00
blocks.content: The infimum regarding an empty base set is always the empty set. (Contributed by AV, 4-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: infempty
blocks.content: The infimum of an empty set under a base set which has a unique greatest element is the greatest element of the base set. (Contributed by AV, 4-Sep-2020.)
